title: NixOS Package PRs for rtkit, gnumake-4.4.1, kgamma5, dconf, kdeconnect-kde, systemd-253.3 packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for rtkit, gnumake-4.4.1, kgamma5, dconf, kdeconnect-kde, systemd-253.3 packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
This allows us to drop our fsck-look-for-fsck-binary-not-just-in- sbin.patch, as it was upstreamed.

items.title: systemd: 253.3 -> 253.4

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This implementation is partly based on #189099 and home-manager's dconf implementation and addresses some related reviews. A main difference between this and #189099 is that this implementation is completely backward-compatible.

items.title: nixos/dconf: support generating from attrs

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This PR is a redesign of the NixOS dconf module and provides a way to solve the issues noted in #54150.

If merged, it presents an alternative to extraGSettingsOverrides that is more reliable as the user can disable overriding options with enableUserDb = false;. Users can store their configurations both as dconf keyfiles or as Nix expressions.

This is how the module can be used:

{
  # With keyfiles
  programs.dconf.profiles.user.databases = lib.singleton (pkgs.dconf-utils.mkDconfDb ./files/dconf);

  # With a Nix expression
  programs.dconf.profiles.user.databases = with lib.dconf; lib.singleton {
    org.gnome.shell = {
      disable-user-extensions = true;
      favorite-apps = [ "firefox.desktop" "thunderbird.desktop" ];
      welcome-dialog-last-shown-version = "999";
    };

    org.gnome.desktop.input-sources = {
      sources = [
        (mkTuple [ "xkb" "en" ])
      ];
      xkb-options = [ "terminate:ctrl_alt_bksp" ];
    };
  };
}
Things done

items.title: nixos/rtkit: Disable debug logging and fix sd_notify

items.content_html:
gnome-keyring needs dconf at runtime and exits with relatively cryptic
error messages if it's not available. Even worse, this adds a one minute
timeout for gnome-keyring to every pam authentication due to the gnome
keyring unlocking module we enable by default.

cc @NixOS/gnome

Description of changes
